Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator is reading as "table with 0 rows and 0 columns" even though there are no tables" (#7891) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069945
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till "Sign In" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till "Sign in with Microsoft" button and press enter​
4.Select valid user id and press enter​
5.Enter any Username, tab till "Register" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
7.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
8.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
9.Turn on scan mode for Narrator by pressing Caps lock + Space bar
10.Now press 'T' key and check the Narrator behavior ​
​
Actual Result:​
On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator is reading as "table with 0 rows and 0 columns" even though there are no tables
​
NOTE: NVDA is working as expected(added attachment for reference)

Expected Result:​
On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator should read as "no next table" when there are no tables on the page
​
Notes:
Couldn't get scan mode working without exploding my browser. I am unsure of why a table is being read out. I suspect there is a table somewhere hidden that is being fed into the narrator.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Lazy DbContext initialization in OData controllers" (#7872) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Since we do the hijacking for great deal of OData requests we get, having DB contexts injected into OData controllers creates unnecessary connections that are likely to be unused.

This change postpones the context initialization until the moment we know for sure we are going to query the DB.

We have some issues with reporting the DB related perf counters from the app service, so verification was done by collecting profiler traces from different versions of the service.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Keyboard focus is lost after "Delete" button." (#7877) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1062703

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Launch application using provided URL.(https://www.nuget.org/)
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “API Keys” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Create" button and hit enter.
6. Enter Values in "Key Name" and "Glob Pattern" field and hit enter on Create button.
7. Navigate to "Manage" control and hit enter.
8. Navigate to the "delete"  button.
9. Check the keyboard focus after delete button.

Actual:
The Keyboard focus is lost after "Delete" button. The keyboard focus is not visible anywhere on the screen after the  delete button focus. 

Expected:
The focus should be visible on the next control after the delete button.

Notes:
This is indicating that keyboard focus is lost after the "Delete" button is interacted. Tabbing afterwards correctly brings focus to the following element, so it appears that the focus is not so much lost as it is not correctly moved forward. We need to focus the next element when delete is pressed so the element with focus is visible. Possibly related stackoverflow https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7208161/focus-next-element-in-tab-index

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]At 150% page zoom images present of left side of screen are not visible." (#7880) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1063665
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the #URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Search for a key term (say “json”) from search box.
5. "Packages returned for json" screen gets opened.
6. Zoom the page to 150%.
7. Check if the images present on left side of the screen are visible. 

Actual:
When the page is zoomed to 150% and above upto 200% the images that are present on left side of the screen are not visible.

Same issue is Observed in "Chrome" also.

Expected:
At 150% page zoom all the content and images that are visible in 100% zoom must also be visible at 150% and above upto 200%.

Notes:
This is actually an issue with the 150% zoom shrinking the horizontal width of the page to the point that the bootstrap stuff kicks in and hides the column with the icon. If I recall, this was by design as we decided that the icon eats up too much space at that width. We should revisit this decision and see if we still agree that this is the correct behaviour.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Package statistics not updating properly" (#7928) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This is an issue which has been going on for a while, but every time it's fixed it seems like it occurs again but slightly differently 😊

In the past the download stats has been frozen and when navigating to "View full stats" you could see that the date of the last update was old. **Now** the stats are not updating but the full stats page says the stats have been updated. For example it's been a while since the download stats increased for our main package:

https://www.nuget.org/packages/Piranha

However, `nuget.org` claims it was updated yesterday.

Given that we have several years of user statistics showing that this never happens it's highly unlikely that there would be **zero** downloads for a longer period. Also when this has occurred in the past, all of a sudden several hundred downloads are all of a sudden added on the statistics, so it gives the impression that the stats are recorded, but not propagated properly on package level for the site to show.

Best regards

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enable generating exact versions in nuspec dependencies" (#7213) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
**Scenario**

Packages generated for multiple projects that are tightly coupled due to usage of InternalsVisibleTo need to use exact versions (e.g. `[1.0.0]`) when they refer to each other in their NuSpec dependency specification rather than right-open version range (e.g. `[1.0.0)`). Currently packages generated via Pack task only allow the latter.

**Proposal**
1. Allow `ProjectVersion` metadata of `ProjectReferencesWithVersions` items consumed by the `PackTask` to be version ranges. `ProjectVersion` string [parsing](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/50af5271b98ac5cb2896a707569bc4cd1e87a017/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack/PackTaskLogic.cs#L693) can be trivially updated to support ranges.

2. Allow specifying `ExactVersion="true"` metadata on `ProjectReference`, include the flag in assets.json and use it when initializing `ProjectReferencesWithVersions.ProjectVersion` to create closed range version.

This proposal allows projects to opt-into exact versions with project references annotated manually or automatically based on presence of InternalsVisibleTo using custom targets.

## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
